resources.string: We can\'t show your schedule because your system is Off. Please turn it back to Heat, Cool or Dual to see your schedule.
A connection error has occurred, please check your connection and try again.
Tap to go to your device
Tap to view all your devices in a list
Long press to edit your dashboard
You can bring back devices at anytime by tapping Add + button
Quick Heat failed, your device is offline.
Quick Cool failed, your device is offline.
To keep things simple, we recommend you install one product at a time.
Check that the device is fitted, plugged in and turned on, or has the batteries inserted.
When in pairing mode, light bulbs will flash on and off and a light will flash on other products, while they search for your hub.
When ready to pair, tap "Go" and the device will show up on your screen when found.
When in pairing mode: thermostats will show \"Pairing\", light bulbs will flash on and off and the light will flash on other products; while they search for your hub.
Welcome to Hive, Log in screen
To use Hive temperature shortcuts you need to be logged in first. Once you\'ve logged in you can add as many as you like to your home screen.
Your username is normally the email address that you provided when purchasing Hive.\n\nIf you can\'t remember your password, just press the "Forgotten password?" link.
Good news, a new Hive service awaits!

We are working on a brand new service that will help users know when their homes are not heating properly. You qualify to have early and free access to this service and we would love to offer you a spot as a Beta tester.
First plug your hub into your broadband and power supply. Then enter the Hub ID. This is the XXX-123 number on the bottom of the hub.
Receive system alerts via email when your hive hub is unreachable.
Receive general operational alerts via email.
Your Hub 360 is set up and ready to use.
Your password must be 8 characters or more with at least one number and no special characters.
Password reset instructions have been sent to your email. Please check your email (maybe located in your spam folder) and click on the verification token link sent to you. Once reset, log in again.
Please enter the email address for your Hive account and we will send you a link to reset your password
If you want to rename your heating zones select manage devices from the options below.
If you have forgotten the PIN you will need to visit the Hive website to reset it. \n\nAlternatively, you can log out to log back in again with your email address and password.
Enter your pin to remove the pin lock
We will notify you when you leave home if your heating is set above this
We will notify you when you return home if your heating is set below this
Geolocation will only work if one or more of your thermostats is on or active
Geolocation uses your location as a center point from which to base your proximity alerts. For better accuracy, please ensure you are connected to your wifi.
Would you like to change your heating from %s?
Would you like to change your %1$s zone from %2$s?
As a Hive Multizone user, Geolocation will apply to all your heating zones.
We will notify you when you leave home if any of your zones are set above this
We will notify you when you return home if any of your zones are set below this
Would you like to check your temperature?
Please enable Wireless Networks / Wi-Fi in location services in order to use the Hive Geolocation feature.
Are you sure you want to reset your location?
This will delete your current location
Without this permission the app is unable to use your location to properly set up some Hive products and features. Are you sure you want to deny this permission?
Check the current mode, temperature and target
Turns your hot water on to continually keep your hot water warm.
Turns your hot water off. Your hot water will remain off until you turn it on, set it to schedule or boost it.
Turns your hot water schedule on. Use this to return to your usual hot water schedule after using ‘HW ON’, or if your hot water was previously off.
Turn your hot water on for 1 hour to Boost your hot water, handy for when you need hot water quickly. After 1 hour the system will return to its previous status.
Sends you back the current mode of your hot water system.
Request a list of available text commands.
To amend your personal details, please call %1$s
To amend your personal details, please call Hive. Please see %s for details
To amend your personal details, please email to %1$s

To amend your personal details, please contact Hive hub. Email help.ITA@hivehome.com

%s
To amend your personal details, please contact us.
Hive Active Heating™ subscription for British Gas
Activate Holiday mode when you\'re going away for peace of mind. Edit your holiday settings
Sorry, we don\'t support separate holiday mode times for heating zones in the app. To see the status of all your zones here, please cancel holiday mode and reset.
Sorry, we don\'t support separate holiday mode times for heating zones in the app. To see the status of all your zones here, please stop holiday mode and reset.
Your home is now in holiday mode
Your heating is set to stay at %s, a little toasty if your home\'s empty. Setting a schedule instead could help you save energy while you\'re away.\n\nThis pop-up won\'t show again
Activate vacation mode when you’re going away for peace of mind.

Exciting news for Hive Active Heating users.
 Based on your feedback we've made some 
 changes to make it simpler and easier to 
 control your heating.
By tapping Done you are agreeing to\n the Heating Alerts terms and conditions.
What have you connected to the Acc terminal?
Click the \'+\' button to add schedule items
Your hot water schedule is active
Your hot water schedule is inactive
Your heating schedule is not being used
Are you sure you want to reset %1$s\'s schedule to the default schedule?
Start time adjusted to %s to allow space for other time slots
End time adjusted to %s to allow space for other time slots
Start and end times adjusted to allow space for other time slots
Start and end times adjusted to allow space for other time slots XXX
Start and end times adjusted to allow space for other time slots YYY
The new slot must have 15 minutes gap with the previous and the next slots
Schedules are currently not available for Philips Hue Lights. If you wish to schedule your lights you can from the Hue app.
Your heating is not in schedule mode.
We couldn\'t find a device that can be controlled by this widget, please go to hivehome.com to see our full range of products.
This widget is not compatible with your devices, please go to hivehome.com/faqs to find out more.
We\'re looking for your new product.
Please insert the batteries or plug it in and make sure it\'s switched on. To keep things simple, we\'ll install one product at a time. (if you have more than one).
Please make sure you\'ll have wifi for the next 20 mins and your phone battery level is above 50%.
Please tap to confirm that you have removed the batteries from your old thermostat\u0020
Please remove the batteries from your old thermostat, then tap to confirm you have done this.
This could take a few minutes
Great, we\'ve found your new device. What would you like to call it?
You can now access all the new features. Tap the button below to continue.
Tap the button below to continue.
What would you like to do? Please choose from the following options below.
There are the products\n we were able to find.
You can finish install by tapping Continue,\n or add more devices.
Note: if you’re installing a Hive Active ThermostatTM, please press Check on the thermostat to confirm your wiring.
Call us so we can upgrade your firmware so you can install your new thermostat.
Call us so we can upgrade your firmware so you can install your new thermostat. Please see %s for details.
Sorry, we couldn\'t find your product, please try the following:
1. Your product is plugged in and switched on
3. Turn your hub off and back on again
4. Move your new product closer to your hub
Please call Hive to help you finish the upgrade process. Our opening hours are 08:00 to 21:00, seven days a week.
Call Hive and we will help you finish the upgrade process. Please see %s for details.
Email help.ITA@hivehome.com and we will help you finish the upgrade process. Please see %s for details.
Please take your batteries out of your old thermostat and tap try again to upgrade.\n
Clicking remove will mean that your device is no longer connected to your hub and you won\'t be able to use it remotely.
Selecting Remove will mean that your camera is no longer connected and you won\'t be able to use it. Your event history, recordings and any settings will be deleted.
Removing this will also remove Hive Actions that include this device. To keep them, go to ‘Actions’ in the menu and remove this device from the actions before continuing.
Tap the button below to reboot your hub this should just take a couple of minutes.
While your hub is restarting the LED(s) will flash. This should stop in a couple of minutes.
A device has been removed, if you\'d like to re-install go to Install devices in the Menu.
This device is an advanced remote\nmonitoring tool that collects data. Please\nsee our Privacy Policy for details.
Plug in your Hive Camera\nto turn it on.

When the Hive Camera light flashes red,
press and hold the Wi-Fi button on the
back of the camera for 5 seconds. When
the light changes to yellow/green, you're
ready for Wi-Fi pairing.
Select your camera from the list below \n(HiveCamera-XXXXXX).
Without this permission the app is unable to use your location to properly set up some Hive products and features. Are you sure you want to deny this permission?
Please enable location permissions in your settings to continue with your setup.
We are establishing a connection and\npreparing your camera.
Make sure your phone and camera are in close proximity to each other.
Choose your Wi-Fi from the list below
This can take up to 3 minutes.\nDuring this time the Hive Camera\nlight will go from blue to green.
Choose a name and enter password for your camera
Choose a name and enter password for your camera
This camera was previously registered.\nPlease enter the password used.
This may take a short while.
Your Hive Camera is successfully set up.
Your Hive Camera is back online.
Wait until the camera LED changes from blue to green. \nThis should take about 3 minutes.
The password you have provided is incorrect, or a network problem has occurred. \nPlease reconnect to your camera
Camera did not find any WiFi networks nearby
Password must be 5 chars or more
Password must be 8 chars or more
Save your recordings to your SD Card
Before removing your SD Card turn this off to avoid possible damage to the card
Select the quality of video for your recordings. Higher resolution video requires a faster internet connection to stream seamlessly.
Allow the oldest recordings to be overwritten by new recordings when the SD card becomes full.
Reset your SD Card and erase all content stored.
Formatting the SD card will remove all data on the card, are you sure you want to continue?
Your SD card has been successfully formatted.
There was an error in formatting your SD card
Clicking delete will mean that your camera is no longer connected and you won\'t be able to use it
The device could not deleted, please try again
Please wait we update your account

1: Check the affected camera has power by confirming the camera is connected to mains power and switched on at the wall socket. If not, plug it in, turn the wall socket on, and wait a couple of minutes for the camera to restart

2: Check your home Wi-Fi is switched on and working. Please refer to the guide that came with you broadband router for this

3: If the camera has changed location or you want to use a different WIFI network please re-install the camera.
Error saving camera password due to wrong password
Network transmission performance can be affected when enabling the image encryption option.
The new camera passwords do not match
Current camera password does not match
Your camera name must be at least 1 character.
Camera rename failed, please try again
To use this feature access to the microphone is required.
Are you sure you want to delete this event from your event log?
Could not connect camera to WiFi
Error getting current live stream settings
Failed to set Wide Dynamic Range
Failed to set Lens Distortion Correction
The maximum number of activity zones has been reached.
Please go to camera settings and enable motion detection to use activity zones.
A firmware update is available for your camera. Please update now for the latest features. Your camera will restart during this process.
Firmware update started. Please do not power down the camera or disconnect the WiFi during a firmware update.
Here you can set up your actions to make your home work for you.
Select from the actions below and define which settings and devices you want to connect.
Your notifications are set to always on
Hive can’t reach the server right now. Please try again in a few minutes.
You currently have no actions set up.\nTap \'+ Add a new action\' to get started
Please choose at least one of the notification options
You have discovered a\nHive Live feature!
You must be a subscriber to use:\n%s
Here you can set up your rules to make your home work for you.
You can choose to add this action again later.
Would you like to save this action?
Would you like to save the changes you\'ve made to this action?
Failed to activate Geolocation feature, please try again later!
Google Play services: unable to resolve connection error.
One of your devices is offline.
Sorry, your hub is not talking to us, it\'s appearing offline - check its connection.
Sorry, your hub is not talking to us, it\'s appearing offline - check its connection.
Oops! Something went wrong, please try again.
Oops! Something went wrong, please try again. >>
Sorry, we cannot find these login details - please check and try again.
Oops! Hive needs an internet connection to work - please check and try again.
Sorry, we cannot find your hub - check its ID number and internet connection.
To complete your hive installation, please pair your hub with all devices.
Sorry, your Hive account is on hold, waiting to be cancelled. Please call the Hive team for more info.
Sorry, your Hive account is on hold, waiting to be cancelled. Please call the Hive team for more info, see %s for details.
Sorry we didn\'t recognise your log-in details. Please check your hive username and password, then try again.
Sorry, one too many login attempts have locked your account. Click on the Forgotten Password button to unlock it and reset your password.
Your thermostat battery is running low.
Sorry, we cannot find this email address - please check and try again.
Oops! That does not look like your old password, please try again.
Oops! Your new passwords do not match. Please check and try again.
Oops! Your password must be 8 characters or more with at least one number and no special characters.
Oops! Your password must be 8 characters or more with at least one number and no special characters.
Oops! Your new password cannot be the same as your old one.
Oops! That does not look like your old password, please try again.
Oops! Your password must be 8 characters or more with at least one number and no special characters.
Oops! Your password must be 8 characters or more with at least one number and no special characters.
Please choose an end time that is later than the start time
Sorry, we cannot find your hub - check its ID number and internet connection.
This number is already registered to a Hive account.
Oops! Your new pin codes don\'t match. Please check and try again.
Error, Pin is incorrect, Please Try again
You have entered the wrong pin too many times and have been logged out as a security precaution. Enter your details to log in again.
PIN must be different from previous PIN
Oops! Use only letters when entering a contact name.
Sorry, cannot save. This user is deleted. Please do a refresh to get latest details
Max users added, please refresh to get updates
Return date and time must be later than departure date and time
Departure time may not be in the past
Please enter a valid device name - use only letters and numbers.
The device that has been installed is not supported by Hive Multizone. Please call Hive for support. Our opening hours are 08:00 – 21:00, seven days a week.
The device that has been installed is not supported by Hive Multizone. Please call Hive for support, see %s for details.

Your schedule is missing at present. To get it back again you should restart your hub. To do this please tap the button below. This will restart your hub and log you out of the Hive app. Please wait 10 minutes and then log back into the app.
Oops! Something went wrong, please try again.
Oops! Something went wrong, please try again.
Sorry, we have an connection issue.
Sorry, We are experiencing some data issues can you please refresh your local data
Sorry, We are experiencing some server issues please try again later
Sorry, You need to re-login to continue.
Sorry, Your last request was invalid please recheck your input.
Please enter a valid 10 digit, Irish mobile number
Please enter a valid (UK) 11 digit mobile number.
Please enter a valid (US) 10 digit mobile number.
Please enter a valid (CA) 10 digit mobile number.

1. Unplug your hub’s power supply and plug back in again

2. Check your device has power, is turned on or has batteries

3. When the hub lights stop flashing, tap refresh
Please try the following steps in order:
If the above steps have not helped please call Hive for support.
If the previous steps have not helped call Hive and we will help you. Check %s for our support hours.
If the previous steps have not helped please email help.ITA@hivehome.com. Check %s for our support hours.
If the above steps have not helped, please call Hive from 08:00-21:00, seven days a week.

1: Check the plug has power by confirming the wall socket is on, if not, turn it on, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

2: If you have other Hive devices, check they are all powered by turning them on at the light switch or wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

3: Turn the affected plug off and back on again at the wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

4: Check your Hive Hub is placed correctly by following the guide here

5: At your Hive Hub turn it off and back on again at the wall socket, wait 10 minutes and press refresh

1: Press the back button on the thermostat to ensure the device has power, if not, replace the batteries and wait a couple of minutes then press refresh

2: If you have other Hive devices, check they are all powered by turning them on at the light switch or wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

3: Press the tab at the bottom of the thermostat and lift off the wall. Remove and then reinsert a battery, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

4: Check your boiler module has a light, if not, ensure mains power switch for boiler is on

5. If there is no light on the boiler module with the power switched on, you need to call us on the number below (click refresh). If you have a green light, please turn the mains power switch for the boiler off and back on, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

6. Check your Hive Hub is placed correctly by following the guide here

7: At your Hive Hub turn it off and back on again at the wall socket, wait 10 minutes and press refresh

1: Press the back button on the thermostat to ensure the device has power, if not, replace the batteries and wait a couple of minutes then press refresh

2: If you have other Hive devices, check they are all powered by turning them on at the light switch or wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

3: Press the tab at the bottom of the thermostat and lift off the wall. Remove and then reinsert a battery, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

4: Check your boiler module has a light, if not, ensure mains power switch for boiler is on

5. If there is no light on the boiler module with the power switched on, you need to contact us. If you have a green light, please turn the mains power switch for the boiler off and back on, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

6. Check your Hive Hub is placed correctly by following the guide here

7: At your Hive Hub turn it off and back on again at the wall socket, wait 10 minutes and press refresh

1: Remove the thermostat faceplate from the wall

2: Check you wires are secure and in the correct terminals

Tip: You can compare this to the photo you took when you installed your thermostat

3: Put the faceplate back on, confirm your wiring and tap refresh below

1: Check the affected light has power by confirming the light switch or wall socket is on, if not, turn it on, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

2: If you have other Hive devices, check they are all powered by turning them on at the light switch or wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

3: Turn the affected light off and back on again at the light switch or wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

4: Check your Hive Hub is placed correctly by following the guide here

5: At your Hive Hub turn it off and back on again at the wall socket, wait 10 minutes and press refresh

1: If you have other Hive devices, check they are all powered by turning them on at the light switch or wall socket, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

2: On the sensor press the side markings and pull open the case. Remove and then reinsert the battery, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh

3: Check your Hive Hub is placed correctly by following the guide here

4: At your Hive Hub turn it off and back on again at the wall socket, wait 10 minutes and press refresh

1. Ensure that your Wi-Fi router has power, is switched on and connected to the internet.

2. If you have a new router, changed your Wi-Fi network name or password, click the link below.

Update Wi-Fi settings

3. If the light on the device does not flash every 30 seconds, replace the batteries.
After you have checked all of the above, press the button on the device and tap refresh.

1: Go to your thermostat

2: Take the thermostat body off the wall

3: Check the wires are in the correct terminals

4: Replace the thermostat body

5: Press check on the thermostat (if the wires are correct) and tap refresh

1: Check the affected camera has power. Make sure the camera is connected to mains power, switched on at the wall socket, and powered on.

2: Check your home Wi-Fi is switched on and working. Please refer to the guide that came with you broadband router for this

3: Turn the affected camera off and back on again, and wait a couple of minutes for the camera to restart

Here you can take a glance at the status of your home. Easily control and navigate between devices with one tap.
You don\'t have any devices to add to your dashboard. Please go to \'Install devices\'
Plug in your signal booster halfway between your hub and the device that has poor signal.
Control tab. Double tap to select
Schedule tab. Double tap to select
Actions tab. Double tap to select
Actions tab. Double tap to select
Light is ON. Double click to deactivate it
Light is OFF. Double click to activate it
Light is set to schedule mode
Light is set to manual mode
The Hive app needs updating to continue to work with all your devices.
Make sure auto-updates are enabled to keep using the latest version of our app.
You need the Hive Leak Alert Plan to use this service
Activate your Hive Leak Alert Plan
You should have received an email with a link to activate your plan. Please check your email and tap refresh.
Call Hive from 08:00 - 21:00,\nseven days a week.
Remove the tab from the side of the device.
Press and hold the button on the device for 10 seconds and make sure that the light flashes double amber.
If the light is not flashing amber, tap here.
Connect Hive leak sensor to your phone
Hive leak sensor is connected with you phone
Now we need to connect the device to your home Wi-Fi
Hold the button for 20 seconds until the light flashes three times.
If the light is still not flashing please call Hive
We’re open 8:00-21:00, seven days a week.
Go to your phones WiFi settings (Settings page > Wi-Fi) and connect the Hive leak sensor.
When connected come back to this screen.
Choose the Wi-Fi network that you want your Hive Leak Sensor to connect to
Enter your Wi-Fi network name and password
Choose your Wi-Fi from the list:
We\'ve successfully connected Hive Leak Sensor to your Wi-Fi.
Ensure your Wi-Fi router is powered and connected to the internet.
Please ensure you are entering the correct password.
Find your main water shutoff valve
Your water valve may look like one of the options above. It is usually located next to the sink.
Help me find my main water valve
Choose the correct clip\naccording to your pipe size
Attach and turn the clip\non the Leak sensor
Turn the clip so that the\narrows are facing each other.
Clip the device to the pipe
Clip the device to the pipe as close to the stop tap as possible and on the side that water enters your house.
Where should I clip the device?
1. Flush your toilet to help us learn\n about the water in your home.
2. Press the button on the device
This can take up to 24 hours
…if your sensor picks up higher then normal water use at home. This might be someone having a long shower or washing the car, but it could be a leak.
This may be a potential leak, or simply when you are watering the garden or someone is taking a long shower.
NOTIFY ME WHEN WATER IS RUNNING LONGER THAN:
Your leak sensor will notify you as soon as it detects that something\'s not right.
…if there\'s a constant small flow of water into your home. We\'ll help you diagnose if it\'s a small leak or just a dripping tap.
Help me find my main water valve
Well done! Hive Leak Sensor\nis successfully set up
Your Leak Sensor will start to learn about the water usage in your home. You won\'t receive any notifications during the first 24 hours
Nofity me when water is flowing longer than:
This means that you could have a burst pipe or a tap fully running and we will only notify you after the time you have now selected.
How would you like to be notified?
You must select at least one method of notification
Hive leak sensor not found, please check your device.
Could not connect to Hive leak sensor
Could not set user id on device
Could not verify user id on device

Notifies you if there\'s an unusual amount of water flowing in your home and helps you find a plumber if you need one.
You can only install one leak sensor per account.
We’ll continue to alert you if water is running for over %1$d minutes.
We’ll continue to alert you if water is running.
You can adjust this time by tapping settings
Hello, we have detected small amounts of water continuously flowing in your home.
We detected a Low water flow at %1$s. Want us to help you find it?
We detected High water usage at %1$s in your home. Have you recently used a large amount of water?
This may be a dripping tap or toilet
A large amount of water has been flowing for over %d minutes in your home.
A large amount of water has been flowing in your home.
Have you recently used a large amount of water?
What is a High water usage alert?
Here are the most common reasons for this alert
Check to see if any of your taps or showers are dripping.
Check to see if water is running from any of your taps or showers.
Check by listening out for a constant trickling sound for long periods after flushing.
Check the pipework leading to washing machines and dishwashers. Some fridges have a water pipe to them too.
Shut off your water supply\nand call for assistance
Your Leak Sensor needs some time to learn about your water, this can take up to 24 hours. We\'ll let you know if anything changes.
Tip: The Leak Sensor will learn faster if less water is used during this time.
You received this alert because there was a High water usage that lasted longer than your set threshold.
You can change the time duration of the notifications for high water usage by tapping settings.
Please enable Wireless Networks / Wi-Fi in location services in order to connect your Hive leak sensor.

As a loyal Hive subscriber you now have access to a new feature! Heating Alerts notify you when something may be wrong with your heating.
Heating Alerts tell you if your home isn’t heating up as quickly as normal.
It could be there’s a problem with your boiler, or just a window has been left open.
Once you receive a Heating Alert you can go to your Hive app to diagnose the problem.
Note: It takes us about 2 weeks to get to know your heating before you start getting alerts.
You can always change your Heating Alerts settings in Menu > Settings > Heating Alerts
If we still think there’s an issue, you’ll receive a reminder next time you open your Hive app.
We noticed that your home is not heating up as it should. Do you want help troubleshooting?
We noticed an issue with your heating earlier. We’ll let you know if it happens again.
We noticed an issue with your heating earlier. We’ll let you know if it happens again when your heating’s on next.

3. Try deleting Philips Hue and re-pairing the bridge.
Please try the following in order:
1. Check the affected light has power by confirming the light switch or wall socket is on. If not, turn it on, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh
2. Check that your Philips Hue bridge is powered and connected to your router.
4. In the Hue app if you’re unable to control your lights please contact Philips Hue for support.
After you have checked all of the above, press the button on the device and tap refresh.
You\'ll need to have Hive Lights to create groups.
This group will be deleted and your lights will appear on your dashboard individually. Do you want to continue?

1. Check the affected light has power by confirming the light switch or wall socket is on. If not, turn it on, wait a couple of minutes and press refresh 

2. Check that your Philips Hue bridge is powered and connected to your router.

3. In the Hue app if you're unable to control your lights please contact Philips Hue for support.
Push the button on Philips Hue Bridge to pair it with your Hive app.
You can now use your Hive app to control your Philips Hue lights. Any routines or timers in the Hue App will remain active.

If you have a schedule setup outside the Hive app with your Philips Hue Lights this will remain active even if you set a Hive schedule. Please disable any other timers or routines if you wish to use Hive to control the schedule to avoid any conflict.
